channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: South Korea arrests the founder of one of its biggest internet companies over a K-pop stock rigging scandal
item.description: South Korean authorities have arrested Kakao Corp. founder Brian Kim over allegations of market manipulation.

item.title: Palestinian rivals Hamas and Fatah sign reconciliation agreement in China
item.description: This is far from the first time the rival groups have signed reconciliation pacts, only to return to hostilities due to persistent disagreements.

item.title: UPS stock dives after profit, revenue miss expectations, outlook trimmed
Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway cuts its stake in EV giant BYD to under 5%, dropping below Hong Kong’s disclosure threshold
item.description: The days of calling BYD a “Buffett-backed” company may soon be coming to a close.

item.title: GM indefinitely delays Cruise Origin autonomous vehicle
item.description: General Motors is indefinitely delaying production of its Origin autonomous vehicle as its embattled Cruise self-driving unit attempts to relaunch operations.

item.title: Porsche warns on profit due to aluminum shortage
Finance guru Dave Ramsey believes spousal interviews should be part of the hiring process: ‘Discover if your candidate is married to crazy’
item.description: "As the spouse hears about your culture and the job role, they’re usually eager to share whether they think the position fits."

item.title: Comcast reports earnings before the bell
item.description: Comcast will report earnings before the bell on Tuesday as Wall Street remains focused on the broadband and streaming businesses.

item.title: Wiz will focus on IPO after rebuffing $23 billion Google deal: reports
The global M&A market’s big-deal bravado is losing steam as rates stay high in 2024
item.description: The largest sector for M&A globally was technology, with deal volume up 37% year on year, of which North America made up some 66% of the total.

item.title: Coca-Cola is about to report earnings. Here's what Wall Street expects
item.description: Shares of Coke have risen 9% this year, bringing its market cap up to $282.3 billion.

item.title: Kamala Harris has support of enough delegates to become Democratic nominee
European cities are trying to shun young ‘drunk’ tourists in favor of big spenders, but there are concerns the move could be classist
item.description: “We don’t want the tourists who come to do what they can’t do in their own countries,” says Mateu Hernández, director-general of Turisme de Barcelona.

item.title: Delivery Hero, Glovo targeted in EU cartel investigation
item.description: EU antitrust regulators have launched a probe into Delivery hero and Glovo on concerns the two firms may have taken part in an online food delivery cartel.

item.title: Is Broadcom’s stock benefiting from Nvidia ‘fatigue’?
